title: Upgrading nats capability provider to 0.15 standards
Updating 0.15 providers to actor interface pinned versions
body: This will allow us to re-release our capability providers, including a release to crates.io where they can be imported as libraries.

title: Updated logging provider to 0.15 compliance and interface versions
body:
PR incoming with all other providers updated to use interface versions.

This logging provider has been tested and verified to log messages that are logged in an actor, both using `write_log` directly and using log macros (e.g. `error!`, `info!`).

title: Update S3 to 0.15 compliance and blobstore actor interface
body:
Related to #12 

This updates the S3 provider to 0.15 compliance and using the `wasmcloud:blobstore` contract ID and actor interface.

I've confirmed that the previous test suite runs & passes, I've also included a `docker run` oneliner for future tests of this project because it took me a few minutes to track down the exact Minio server flags that I needed.

title: FS provider 0.15
body:
Updated FS provider to use `wasmCloud` terminology and the `blobstore` actor interface for its shared types.

Tests are passing alongside the `actor-interface` doctest. The badges in the README will likely be corrupted for the time being until we get this provider published onto crates.io.

Related to #12

title: Http-server & Redis 0.15.0 Updates
body:
Updates `http-server` provider and `redis` provider to 0.15.0 compliance by using generated data types from `actor-interfaces` and using the `wasmcloud:httpserver` and `wasmcloud:keyvalue` capability contract IDs, respectively. 

I have not addressed all concerns from #12, so I'm creating a Draft PR for now to check in my code. @autodidaddict I will reach out to you next week to make sure I know how to address the rest of the concerns there so I can convert this PR.

title: Redisgraph use actor interfaces
body: This PR uses the graphdb interface from https://github.com/wasmCloud/actor-interfaces/pull/20/files as well as the `actor-core` interface to rewrite the redisgraph provider and actor API.

title: Automated build & release actions for individual providers
body:
Fixes #16

All of these additions here are copy/pasted from the TEMPLATEs in the `.github/workflows` directory, so it's all the same code coming in. Each individual build action (the `provider.yml`s) build and test the provider when a file has been modified in that specific provider. This saves a _lot_ of time, especially when we are working on capability providers individually. The release action (`provider-release.yml`) will build, test, and release the provider to `crates.io` and a parJEEzy to our wasmcloud azure registry for distribution. This action is kicked off by pushing a tag to the main branch with the form of `provider-vX.Y.Z`, for example `redisgraph-v0.9.2`. After merging this PR, I will tag an initial release for each provider.

title: Provider CI templates
body:
With the recent success of releasing `nats`, I created templates so we can easily create the GH actions for future providers. Looking for any feedback on the templates as I'll create all of the other workflow files from these templates after this is approved.

Related to #16

title: Initial commit of NATS key-value replicated in-memory cache
Idempotent configuration binding and support for health checks
body:
0.15.x requires that all capability providers:
* Gracefully ignore attempts at binding actors that are already bound
* Support returning a health status in response to a health check

title: Fix Makefile build targets
body: The common Makefile had an error that resulted in `cross build ...` not getting called.

title: NATS Upgrade
body: Merging in commits from the upstream PR for upgrading NATS

title: Add Makefile to providers for par creation
body:
A Makefile at the root provides targets for copying the common Cross.toml and provider makefiles to all the providers.

This also adds a README.md indicating some basic usage and caveats on platform support.

title: corrected cargo clippy working dir, not using action
Implement GH action to build / test providers individually
